ğŸŒ³Yishun Park was built on a former rubber plantation site. Some rubber trees and fruit trees can still be found around the lush hilly park.
ğŸ›ğŸ The hilly Park was developed with facilities like Playground, Nature Playgarden, Fitness Station, Allotment Garden, Amphitheatre and Dog Run that were mostly located on lower ground of the Park centred around it's entrance plaza.
ğŸ§¢There are 3 main entrances to the Park.
1. They are Dipterocarpus Entrance near to SAFRA Yishun at the South, 2. Hopea Entrance at the junction of Yishun Central and Yishun Ave 11 at the North, and
3. Shorea entrance opposite Yishun Park Hawker Centre at the East.
ğŸ¢Yishun Park is connected to Yishun Pond Park by an overhead bridge with a Spiral Tower.
ğŸšGetting here:
Bus 103 & 812 stops right in front of the Park.
Board bus from Yishun Interchange.
ğŸŒ²Fun note:
ğŸ¥¬Yishun Park was once part of a plantation that belonged to Chye Kay Village, located at present-day Nee Soon East.
ğŸŒ³Dipterocarpus, Hopea and Shorea are native tree species in Singapore, including in Yishun Park.
Yishun Park is perfect for peaceful morning walks, fitness, or enjoying breakfast at the Hawker Centre amid lush greenery.

Good place to exercise. Watch out for the Monitor lizards, they do not pose any threat. The park is connected to the Yishun Pond and Safra. Walked for about 3km and feels good. Multiple tree species and sounds of cricket.

Another nice park in north.
Big but very busy especially in the morning.
People group here for morning dance and exercise.

This park is PCN friendly.
